December 7, 1953
1240 Bryden Road
Columbus, Ohio
s COPY
Mr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
* Dear Mr* Skornia:
I enjoyed my very short visit last Thursday with you and
Mr. Hdlt. The problem of launching my projected Report in Europe with
proper sponsorship and distribution in the United-States remains unsolved;
and I suspect I shall be obliged to shelve this idea temporarily. A*
you well know, the category "information specialist” in radio both
in government and in private agencies such as RFE and the late RFA is
very much surplus right now$ and I, very frankly, have been casting
about for something to do since my return from the Orient.
To find something that is genuinely satisfying and
absorbing in institutional oc educational radio is also something of a
task? and therefore, I came over to Urbana to have a first-hand look
at the organization of NAEB because, purely from hearsay, I was
interested. From my talk with you during your lunch hour, I gather
that there will be a specific*opening on the staff for a program
director. This is emphasized, further, I note, in your letter to
Mr. Graham Hovey in Rome in which you point out the need for a o. ogram
director who can and will handle administrative details particular
to policy, program exchange materials, a kind of traveling liaison
with other NAEB members and one who can decide, perhaps, on what
NAEB really wants.
Following your suggestion, too^ that I might make
application for this job, I should like to make a tentative application!
My reservation being that an outline of exactly what duties are entailed,
what authority and responsibility would accompany the job, and
other lines and limits be made clear from the start. I hope you will
agree that this is a reasonable demand! and I rather regret that I had
not stipulated this before when taking my assignment with the Rot Weiss
Rot in Vienna? and while being briefed for the job in Manila recently
with the Committee for Free Asia.
I do believe that my past training and experience
could be profitably used somewhere in the NAEB hierarchy! and perhaps
thl/5 job might be the very one which I could develop and (dare I say)
"grow in” on a long-range view. Perhaps you will understand, after
a series of short-term assignments, I am rather concerned that my next
job in radio hold out the expectation of definite long-range work,
provided, naturally, things work out to mutual satisfaction. I gather
that NAEB is an expanding organization and shows signs of being here to
